Schema.Comment: The eigion role is a least-privilege role that can perform only those operations required to run the system and no others.
Schema.Statement: create role eigion with nosuperuser nocreatedb nocreaterole noinherit nologin;
Schema.Comment: The eigion_none role is a no-privilege role that cannot perform any actions.
Schema.Statement: create role eigion_none with nosuperuser nocreatedb nocreaterole noinherit nologin;
Schema.Comment: The schema version table stores the current version of the database schema. Implementations are expected to query this table on connecting to the database in order to ensure that the calling code is compatible with the tables in the database.
Schema.Statement:
create table schema_version ( version_lock char(1) not null default 'x', version_number bigint not null,
constraint check_lock_primary primary key (version_lock), constraint check_lock_locked check (version_lock = 'x') )

Schema.Comment: The users table stores the current set of users.
Schema.Statement: create table users ( id uuid not null primary key, name varchar(64) not null unique, email varchar(256) not null unique, created timestamp with time zone not null, last_login timestamp with time zone not null, password_algo varchar(64) not null, password_hash varchar(256) not null, password_salt varchar(64) not null )
grant select, insert, update on users to eigion
grant select (id) on users to eigion_none
Schema.Comment: The user_bans table stores the set of users that might be banned for any reason.
Schema.Statement:
create table user_bans ( id bigint not null primary key generated always as identity, user_id uuid not null unique, expires timestamp with time zone, reason varchar(256) not null,
foreign key (user_id) references users (id) )
grant select, insert, update, delete on user_bans to eigion
Schema.Comment: The audit table stores a list of auditable events. Who did it? What did they do? When did they do it?
Schema.Statement:
create table audit ( id bigint not null primary key generated always as identity, user_id uuid not null, time timestamp with time zone not null, type varchar(64) not null, message varchar(8192) not null,
foreign key (user_id) references users (id) )
grant insert, select on audit to eigion

Schema.Comment: The images table holds image data.
Schema.Statement:
create table images ( id uuid not null primary key, creator uuid not null, created timestamp with time zone not null, content_type varchar(256) not null, image_data bytea not null,
foreign key (creator) references users (id) )
grant select, insert on images to eigion
grant update (image_data) on images to eigion
Schema.Comment: The image_redactions table holds the set of images that have been redacted.
Schema.Statement:
create table image_redactions ( image uuid not null unique, reason varchar(256) not null, creator uuid not null, created timestamp with time zone not null,
foreign key (creator) references users (id), foreign key (image) references images (id) )
grant select, delete, insert on image_redactions to eigion
Schema.Comment: The categories table holds the set of categories that can be applied to products.
Schema.Statement: create table categories ( id bigint not null primary key generated always as identity, name varchar(64) not null unique, created timestamp with time zone not null )
grant select, insert on categories to eigion
Schema.Comment: The category_redactions table holds the set of categories that have been redacted.
Schema.Statement:
create table category_redactions ( category bigint not null unique, reason varchar(256) not null, creator uuid not null, created timestamp with time zone not null,
foreign key (creator) references users (id), foreign key (category) references categories (id) )
grant select, delete, insert on category_redactions to eigion
Schema.Comment: The products table holds product definitions.
Schema.Statement:
create table products ( id bigint not null primary key generated always as identity, product_group varchar(1024) not null, product_name varchar(1024) not null, product_title varchar(128) not null, product_description text not null, product_description_type varchar(128) not null, created_by uuid not null, created timestamp with time zone not null,
unique (product_group, product_name),
foreign key (created_by) references users (id) )
grant select, insert on products to eigion
grant update (product_title) on products to eigion
grant update (product_description) on products to eigion
grant update (product_description_type) on products to eigion
Schema.Comment: The product_links table holds links associated with products.
Schema.Statement:
create table product_links ( product bigint not null, link_relation varchar(128) not null, link_location varchar(2048) not null,
foreign key (product) references products (id) )
grant select, insert on product_links to eigion
Schema.Comment: The product_redactions table holds the set of products that have been redacted.
Schema.Statement:
create table product_redactions ( product bigint not null unique, reason varchar(256) not null, creator uuid not null, created timestamp with time zone not null,
foreign key (creator) references users (id), foreign key (product) references products (id) )
grant select, delete, insert on product_redactions to eigion
Schema.Comment: The product_releases table holds product releases.
Schema.Statement:
create table product_releases ( id bigint not null primary key generated always as identity, product_id bigint not null, version_major bigint not null, version_minor bigint not null, version_patch bigint not null, version_qualifier varchar(64) not null, manifest bytea not null, manifest_type varchar(256) not null, created_by uuid not null, created timestamp with time zone not null,
unique (product_id, version_major, version_minor, version_patch, version_qualifier),
foreign key (product_id) references products (id), foreign key (created_by) references users (id) )
grant select, insert on product_releases to eigion
Schema.Comment: The product_release_redactions table holds the set of product releases that have been redacted.
Schema.Statement:
create table product_release_redactions ( release bigint not null unique, reason varchar(256) not null, creator uuid not null, created timestamp with time zone not null,
foreign key (creator) references users (id), foreign key (release) references product_releases (id) )
grant select, delete, insert on product_release_redactions to eigion
Schema.Comment: The product_categories table associates products with categories.
Schema.Statement:
create table product_categories ( category_id bigint not null, category_product bigint not null,
primary key (category_id, category_product), foreign key (category_id) references categories (id), foreign key (category_product) references products (id) )
grant select, insert, delete on product_categories to eigion
